an4.39:4.1: Then Ujjaya the brahmin went up to the Buddha,
an4.39:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
an4.39:4.7: Nor do I criticize all sacrifices.
an4.39:4.8: Take the kind of sacrifice where cattle, goats and sheep, chickens and pigs and various kinds of creatures are slaughtered.
an4.39:4.9: I criticize that kind of violent sacrifice.
an4.39:4.11: Because neither perfected ones nor those who have entered the path to perfection will attend such a violent sacrifice.
an4.39:5.1: But take the kind of sacrifice where cattle, goats and sheep, chickens and pigs and various kinds of creatures are not slaughtered.
an4.39:5.2: I praise that kind of non-violent sacrifice; for example, a regular giving or a traditional family sacrifice.
an4.39:5.4: Because perfected ones and those who have entered the path to perfection will attend such a non-violent sacrifice.”
an4.39:6.4: these huge violent sacrifices yield no great fruit.
an4.39:7.1: The great sages of good conduct
an4.39:8.1: But the great sages of good conduct
an4.39:9.1: An intelligent person should sacrifice like this,
an4.39:9.2: for this sacrifice is very fruitful.
an4.39:9.3: For a sponsor of sacrifices like this,
an4.39:9.5: Such a sacrifice is truly abundant,
an4.39:9.6: and even the gods are pleased.”
